chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: CtrlProxy is configured by a set of plain-text files that live in the .ctrlproxy directory in the users' home directory.

sect1.title: Quick setup
sect1.para: By running ctrlproxy with the --init argument, you can quickly create a configuration file.
sect1.screen:
gwalcmai:~% ctrlproxy --init Please specify port the administration interface should listen on. Prepend with a colon to listen on a specific address. Example: localhost:6668
Port [6680]: 6680 Please specify a password for the administration interface: Configuration created in /home/jelmer/.ctrlproxy.
sect1.para: Once you have created a configuration file, you can hand-edit the files in ~/.ctrlproxy or connect to administration port as specified above using your IRC client and use the admin interface.
